Because of increased growth, range, and duration of growth of pests and weeds, pesticide use is expected to increase, including use in areas where specific pesticides were not previously necessary, thus putting applicators and other workers at increased risk of exposure.
[96,132â€“135] A secondary effect of expanded pest range is illustrated by the expansion of the Mountain Pine beetle in Western states and subsequent build-up of fuels from trees killed by beetles. An increase in wildland fires would put fire-fighters at increased risk.
